text:
Hey, Need a bit of help. I have been tasked to change the bottom right text. Its all as an SVG "Structural Framework" In my illustrator file I have changed the text but when i add the SVG code into the template it goes to the top left above the circle. I guess I need to change the path of the SVG. Could someone point me in the correct location off the path from 

<path class="st8" d="M30,5.3l1.5-0.1C31.6,5.7,31.8,6,32,6.3c0.3,0.2,0.7,0.4,1.1,0.4c0.5,0,0.9-0.1,1.1-0.3

		c-0.5-0.4-0.7-0.9-0.7-1.5c0-0.4,0.1-0.8,0.3-1.1c0.2-0.3,0.5-0.6,1-0.8C32,0.1,32.5,0,33.1,0c1,0,1.7,0.2,2.2,0.6
		c0.5,0.4,0.7,1,0.8,1.7l-1.6,0.1C34.4,2,34.2,1.7,34,1.5c-0.2-0.2-0.5-0.3-1-0.3c-0.5,0-0.8,0.1-1.1,0.3c-0.2,0.1-0.2,0.3-0.2,0.5
		c0,0.2,0.1,0.3,0.2,0.5c0.2,0.2,0.7,0.3,1.4,0.5c0.8,0.2,1.3,0.4,1.7,0.6c0.4,0.2,0.6,0.5,0.8,0.8c0.2,0.3,0.3,0.7,0.3,1.2
		c0,0.4-0.1,0.9-0.4,1.2c-0.2,0.4-0.6,0.7-1,0.9c-0.4,0.2-1,0.3-1.7,0.3c-1,0-1.7-0.2-2.2-0.7C30.4,6.8,30.1,6.2,30,5.3z"/>

Here is a link to the page Original Page - <https://www.geoteric.com/>

Here is a link to the page once I have uploaded the new SVG - <https://www.geoteric.com/?hs_preview=txkYMAqB-6022967000>

James

I would suggest using text nodes instead of expanding the text to paths in AI you can apply fill via CSS on hover still this way for when these kind of changes occur, otherwise you’ll be needing this:

<https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/d#Path_commands>
Who at HS deals with the new Build-As-You-Go email builder beta?
Was curious as to why we cannot add CTA's in the rich text editor
There is also no access to the source area using the new rich text module on it so we can't add a cta in that way either using hubl

Is anyone else experiencing issues with the "Edit Source" window on the Rich text WISYWIG when editing blogs. It's not registering the correct area when i click. I'll click towards the end of the line and the cursor gets placed towards the beginning of the line
console is showing some deprecated warning but i dont think that would cause any issues

Hi all, we’re happy to announce that starting today, HubSpot’s default modules are internationalized in-app. This means that if your portal is set to Spanish, the modules labels and help text will now appear in Spanish as well. In the coming weeks, we’ll be adding the ability for you to create translated clones of custom modules within HubSpot --- stay tuned!

If we're trying to link to a page in the HubSpot portal (ie design manager or marketplace) what can we put in there to automatically take the users hubid IE: <https://app.HubSpot.com/marketplace/HUBIDHERE/products>

I seem to remember that there was a way to make the link work universally

We have shortcodes like this setup across the platform. It works for virtually every top-level feature (i.e. <http://app.HubSpot.com/l/website|app.HubSpot.com/l/website>) and just uses the last Hub ID you logged into.
interesting, would have never guessed - any chance of these helpful things being documented anywhere?
